DataElement.preferredName: Radiation Therapy Targeted Lymph Node Anatomic Site
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Information related to the site of targeted lymph node radiation therapy.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Radiation Therapy Target Lymph Node Anatomic Site
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation._An object fixed as a goal or point of examination; something to point at; a destination._A bean-shaped organ surrounded by a connective tissue capsule. It is part of the lymphatic system and is found throughout the body. It is composed predominantly of lymphocytes and its main function is immune protection._Named locations of or within the body.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: use PHOTOTHERAPY, LASER THERAPY, or ULTRAVIOLET THERAPY for therapeutic radiation with visible, laser, or ultraviolet light, respectively.

Concepts.definition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

Property.preferredDefinition: An object fixed as a goal or point of examination; something to point at; a destination.:A bean-shaped organ surrounded by a connective tissue capsule. It is part of the lymphatic system and is found throughout the body. It is composed predominantly of lymphocytes and its main function is immune protection.:Named locations of or within the body.

Concepts.definition: An object fixed as a goal or point of examination; something to point at; a destination.

A bean-shaped organ surrounded by a connective tissue capsule. It is part of the lymphatic system and is found throughout the body. It is composed predominantly of lymphocytes and its main function is immune protection.
Named locations of or within the body.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: locations or structures in the human body.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 11/7/2019: CM Released as part of draft content review

ValueDomain.preferredName: Radiation Therapy Targeted Lymph Node Anatomic Site
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The site of targeted lymph node radiation therapy.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A lymph node which is located above the clavicle.

Concepts.definition: A lymph node which is located above the clavicle.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any of the lymph nodes of the breast located under the ribcage, near the sternum.

Concepts.definition: Any of the lymph nodes of the breast located under the ribcage, near the sternum.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Axillary lymph nodes located superomedial to pectoralis minor.

Concepts.definition: Axillary lymph nodes located superomedial to pectoralis minor.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Axillary Lymph Node Level II And Axillary Lymph Node Level III
